Class DisplayAxes

Draws linear horizontal and vertical axes within a given simulation coordinates rectangle. The simulation rectangle determines where the axes are drawn, and the numbering scale shown.

Axes are drawn with numbered tick marks. Axes are labeled with names which can be specified by hAxisLabel and vAxisLabel. Axes are drawn using specified font and color.

Options exist for drawing the vertical axis near the left, center, or right, and for drawing the horizontal axis near the top, center, or bottom of the screen. See hAxisAlign and vAxisAlign.

To keep the DisplayAxes in sync with a LabView, when doing for example pan/zoom of the LabView, you can arrange for {@link #setSimRect} to be called by an Observer.

constructor

  • new DisplayAxes(simRect?: DoubleRect, font?: string, color?: string): DisplayAxes
    • Defined in davinci-newton/graph/DisplayAxes.ts:109

    Parameters

    • Default value simRect: DoubleRect = DoubleRect.EMPTY_RECT

      the area to draw axes for in simulation coordinates.

    • Default value font: string = "14pt sans-serif"

      the Font to draw numbers and names of axes with

    • Default value color: string = "gray"

      the Color to draw the axes with

    Returns DisplayAxes

drawHorizTicks

  • drawHorizTicks(y0: number, context: CanvasRenderingContext2D, map: CoordMap, r: DoubleRect): void
    • Defined in davinci-newton/graph/DisplayAxes.ts:197

    Draws the tick marks for the horizontal axis.

    Parameters

    • y0: number

      the vertical placement of the horizontal axis, in screen coords

    • context: CanvasRenderingContext2D

      the canvas's context to draw into

    • map: CoordMap

      the mapping to use for translating between simulation and screen coordinates

    • r: DoubleRect

      the view area in simulation coords

    Returns void
